body_html:
/conferences already offers a link to create a new conference for admins. I would rather re-use that … with a bit of tidying up (ie. moving the hardcore conference editing into the orga-namespace).

We can add a proposed/accepted/rejected state-machine to conferences just like we have for projects. That would mean a conference created by an admin (from within the orga namespace) is automatically accepted, admins get an email when a conference is suggested by somebody else. Open question: who is that somebody else? Anyone registered? Members of accepted teams?

How does that sound in general, taking the suggest-a-conf feature out of the form, that is?

`/conferences` already offers a link to create a new conference for admins. I would rather re-use that … with a bit of tidying up (ie. moving the hardcore conference editing into the orga-namespace).

We can add a `proposed`/`accepted`/`rejected` state-machine to conferences just like we have for projects. That would mean a conference created by an admin (from within the orga namespace) is automatically accepted, admins get an email when a conference is suggested by somebody else. Open question: who is that somebody else? Anyone registered? Members of accepted teams?
